page.title: 05HISTORIC SHERIFF HUTTON
page.content: In 1382,a five storey castle,whose ruins are dramatic,was built to replace the earlier"motte and baily" castle whose outline can still be seen.Among several royal prisoners was the daughter of Edward IV,Princess Elizabeth of York,sent there by Richard III.When the latter was killed in 1485,Elizabeth was married to Henry VII.The castle was the Northern favourite of Henry VIII,who gave it to his bastard son,Duke of Richmond.It was last inhabited in 1547. {The Park}(a Grade 1 listed building)In 1619,a hall was biult in the 14th c. Park,to replace the castle.Stone,oak panelling,lead and stone tiles from the castle were re-used in the new residence.In 1730 it was faced with red brick in Queen Anne style.Statues made in 1638,by known craftsmen,still stand in the Park.
